Monday 's announcement aims to extend the companies ' long - term partnership in three critical areas : enterprise cloud computing with business - critical SAP applications certification for Microsoft Azure ; improved interoperability between data from SAP applications and Microsoft Office , including general availability of connectivity between SAP ( ® ) BusinessObjectsTM business intelligence ( BI ) solutions and Microsoft 's Power BI offering ; and mobile productivity with expanded development and support for Windows and Windows Phone 8.1 .

SAP applications on Microsoft Azure It is anticipated that by the end of Q2 2014 , Microsoft and SAP will support SAP ( ® ) Business Suite software , SAP Business All-In-One solutions , SAP Mobile Platform , SAP Adaptive Server ( ® ) Enterprise ( SAP ASE ) and the developer edition of the SAP HANA ( ® ) platform on Azure .

In addition , Microsoft and SAP expect that customers and developers will be able to deploy and provision a number of preconfigured SAP solutions , within minutes , directly to Azure using the SAP Cloud Appliance Library tool .

In addition , Microsoft and SAP expect that customers and developers will be able to deploy and provision a number of preconfigured SAP solutions , within minutes , directly to Azure using the SAP Cloud Appliance Library tool .
New and existing SAP customers will be able to take advantage of the pay per use model in Azure to reduce infrastructure costs and total cost of ownership .
Customers will be able to take advantage of the compute resources in Azure to support SAP solutions and quickly scale capacity as computing requirements change , paying only for the resources used .

Microsoft and SAP also announced plans to deepen interoperability between applications and platforms with a new version of the SAP Gateway for Microsoft , which is expected to help customers automate business processes and access SAP applications and data through Microsoft Office 365 and Microsoft Azure .
